p: Moreover, at the concentration of 10 µg/mL, α-bisabolol decreased the viability of A549, MCF-7, and HaCaT cell lines of 70%, 10% and 50%, respectively, in comparison with the negative control. The results highlighted that inhibition on cell growth was highly dependent on cell type with IC 50 values ranging from 1.24 ± 0.03 to 100.99 ± 2.32 μg/mL. In particular, MCF-7 cancer cells showed more growth inhibition than HaCaT cells after 48 h of treatment with α-bisabolol (IC 50 = 1.24 ± 0.03 μg/mL vs. IC 50 = 10.15 ± 0.35 μg/mL) and essential oil (IC 50 = 5.59 ± 0.13 μg/mL vs. IC 50 = 21.58 ± 1.26 μg/mL) ( Table 2). As reported in other studies, IC 50 values lower than 30 μg/mL present a good chemopreventive potential for the essential oil [ 20]. However, the HaCaT cells showed to be more sensitive, with IC 50 values ranging from 10.15 ± 0.35 to 27.76 ± 2.76 μg/mL, than the A549 cell line, with IC 50 ranging from 54.28 ± 2.39 to 100.99 ± 2.32 μg/mL. Therefore, the evaluation of the cytotoxic activity revealed promising results in terms of selectivity and efficacy of M. splendens essential oil against the MCF-7 cell line rather than against the A549 ( Table 2).
